title: 'America's Got Talent': Simon Cowell replaces Howard Stern as judge on season 11
text:
Comments 
It's official: Simon Cowell is joining "America's Got Talent" as a judge. 
The former "American Idol" grump is replacing Howard Stern on the NBC reality competition, starting with season 11 next summer. Stern told his radio listeners in June that he was leaving after three years to explore another television opportunity and recommended Cowell as his replacement. 
"I am really thrilled to be joining ' America's Got Talent ' next season," Cowell said in a statement on Thursday. "What I love about this show is that it's open to absolutely anyone. America has some fantastic talent just waiting to be discovered, and I would like that talent to come to our show, including any dogs who can sing!" 
On Twitter, Cowell added that "AGT" is back next year "and the even better news is so am I!" 
According to E! News , Cowell created the "Got Talent" format that now appears in multiple countries, and will remain an executive producer. In addition to "Idol," he also judged the U.S. and U.K. versions of "The X Factor" and earned worldwide fame for his blunt, harsh criticisms of contestants. 
Variety reports the last season of "America's Got Talent" averaged 12.5 million viewers to be the series' most-watched season in four years. 
Auditions for "AGT" are currently underway, with contestants heading to Detroit for the next round on Nov. 7. The talent show, known as "Britain's Got Talent" in Cowell's home country, features singers, dancers, magicians, comedians and other performers competing for a prize of $1 million. 
Contestants with Central New York ties that have appeared on past seasons of "AGT" include comics Leo Lytel and Moody McCarthy , speed painter Robert Channing , the Cornell Bhangra dance troupe, illusionist Leon Etienne , and singers Nick Ziobro , Julia Goodwin and Jonah Smith . 
"America's Got Talent" season 11 will premiere in summer 2016 on NBC.
